items.title: Live: Can Nifty build further gains on monthly expiry day? Midcap, smallcaps in focus | Opening Bell
items.description: In the final half-hour of trading, markets broke out of their rangebound movement, driving the Sensex and Nifty 50 to new all-time highs. The Nifty 50 closed above 26,000 for the first time, though broader markets struggled. Observers are now questioning whether this uptrend can continue. Experts suggest that Nifty 50's new resistance level is set at 26,200, with immediate support at 25,800. However, with the monthly F&O expiry approaching, increased volatility is expected. This morning global cues are mixed, with the US markets ending mixed overnight, while Asia-Pacific markets opened higher this morning. Among stocks in focus, watch out for PB Fintech, Vedanta, Five-Star Business Finance, among others. Meanwhile, market regulator Sebi has launched a dedicated FPI outreach cell to improve and simplify the experience of such investors accessing the Indian securities market. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Chandan Taparia, Senior Vice President, Head - Derivatives & Technical Research, Motilal Oswal and Deepak Ramaraju, Senior Fund Manager, Shriram AMC.

items.title: Agri Picks Report September 26, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, India's food grain output for 2023-24 (Jul-Jun) is estimated at a record 332.3 mln tn, 2.6 mln tn higher than 329.7 mln tn in 2022-23 amid record production of rice and wheat, according to the final estimates released by the government on Wednesday.

items.title: HDFC Bank loan growth may slow down to below 10%; Macquarie bullish, sets Rs 1,900 share price target
items.description: HDFC Bank's reported significant sell-down of loans may slow down its loan growth to below 10 percent. While that may be a part of the bank's strategy to maintain profitability, it may hit ratios in the short term.

items.title: Are tax filing complexities forcing HNIs to ditch PMS and opt for AIF?
items.description: Filing income tax returns in a PMS scheme can be a cumbersome process as all transactions occur in the investor's own demat account, which means that every trade executed by the fund manager triggers a tax event for the individual.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: 10 stocks that moved the most on September 26
items.description: At close, the Sensex was up 666 points or 0.8 percent at 85,836 and the Nifty was up 211 points at 26,216. About 1,603 shares advanced, 2,200 shares declined, and 102 shares remained unchanged. Intraday, Sensex and Nifty reached an all-time high

items.title: Live: Nifty hits new high, tops 26,200 on expiry day | Midcaps bleed for 2nd day | Closing Bell
items.description:
Thrilling Thursday! Markets hit fresh highs. Record rally continues for Sensex, Nifty. Nifty mounts above 26,200 on expiry day. Sensex crosses 85,900-mark for first time. Nifty ends 4th monthly F&O expiry positive. Nifty rises over 3% in Sept, up 15% in 4 months. Nifty Bank, Nifty Auto hits new all-time high. Nifty Metal extend gains to 5th straight day. Nifty Pharma falls post 4-day uptrend. Nifty Midcap bleeds for 2nd day. Nifty Smallcap extend losses for 3rd day. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.
#stockmarket, #sharemarket #nifty #sensex #marketclosing
